page.title: 09AGRICULTURE
page.content: In the south-west of our area the land is almost entirely agricultural. It is intensely farmed in fields of approximately 20 hectares. It is flat and productive land which can be seen from the fact that it is used for crops which require the most fertile soil: oil-seed rape, winter wheat and sugar beet. This would be categorised as Grade 1 agricultural land. The owner of Grange Farm (670 acres) has lived there all his life and employs 4 people to work with the dairy herd and the growing crops. Peas are grown for processing in Lowestoft factories. Towards the east, by the edge of the cliff is an area of wet grassland and some fields of wheat. In square 52 89 much of the land which was used for {agriculture} has been developed as an industrial estate.
